title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl; cream together butter; white sugar; and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in eggs one at a time; then stir in vanilla.
In a separate bowl; combine flour; baking soda; and salt. Gradually add this to the butter mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.

title: Homemade Apple Pie
ingredients: 6 cups Apples; peeled; cored; and sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a large bowl; mix together apples; sugars; cinnamon; nutmeg; and flour.
Roll out one pie crust and place it in a pie dish.
Pour the apple mixture into the crust.
Roll out the second pie crust and place it over the apples.
Seal and flute the edges; and cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Grease and flour four ramekins.
In a microwave-safe bowl; melt the butter and chocolate chips together.
Stir in powdered sugar.
Stir in eggs and egg yolks until well combined.
Stir in flour until just combined.
Divide the batter among the prepared ramekins.
Bake for 12-14 minutes or until the edges are set but the center is still soft.
Let it cool for a few minutes before inverting onto plates. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

title: Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients: 1 pound Fresh strawberries; hulled and sliced
instructions: In a bowl; combine sliced strawberries and sugar. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
Slice the shortcakes horizontally.
Spoon strawberries onto the bottom half of each shortcake.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and place the other half of the shortcake on top.

title: Classic Vanilla Cupcakes with Buttercream Frosting
ingredients: Frosting ingredients: Butter; powdered sugar; vanilla extract; milk
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl; cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time; then stir in vanilla.
In a separate bowl; whisk together flour and baking powder.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture; alternating with the milk.
Pour batter into cupcake liners and bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.

title: Raspberry Cheesecake Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F.
In a bowl; combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a greased 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl; beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Add eggs; one at a time; beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla; sour cream; and flour.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust.
Warm the raspberry jam slightly and drop spoonfuls over the cream cheese mixture.
Use a knife to create a swirled pattern.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the center is set.
Allow to cool before cutting into bars.

title: Banana Bread Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl; combine cubed bread and mashed bananas.
In a separate bowl; whisk together milk; brown sugar; eggs; vanilla extract; cinnamon; and salt.
Pour the wet ingredients over the bread mixture and stir to combine.
Fold in chopped walnuts if desired.
Let the mixture sit for 15-20 minutes to allow the bread to absorb the liquid

title: Triple Chocolate Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a saucepan; melt the butter. Remove from heat and stir in sugar; eggs; and vanilla.
In a separate bowl; combine flour; cocoa powder; and salt. Add this to the butter mixture.
Fold in semi-sweet chocolate chips and white chocolate chips.
Pour the batter into a greased 9x9-inch baking pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few moist crumbs.
Let it cool before cutting into squares.

title: Peach Cobbler
ingredients: 6 cups Fresh or canned peaches; sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl; combine peaches; white sugar; brown sugar; cinnamon; and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl; whisk together melted butter; flour; baking powder; salt; and milk.
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spoon the peach mixture over the batter without stirring.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

title: Lemon Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl; cream together softened butter and powdered sugar.
Stir in 2 cups of flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom of a greased 9x13-inch baking pan.
Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly golden.
In another bowl; whisk together eggs; white sugar; 1/3 cup flour; lemon juice; and lemon zest.
Pour the lemon mixture over the baked crust.
Bake for an additional 25 minutes or until the center is set.
Let it cool before dusting with powdered sugar and cutting into bars.

title: Mango Sorbet
ingredients: 4 cups Fresh mango; peeled and diced
instructions: In a saucepan; combine sugar and water. Heat over medium heat until sugar is dissolved; creating a simple syrup.
Let the simple syrup cool completely.
In a blender; combine fresh mango; simple syrup; and lime juice. Blend until smooth.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Transfer the sorbet to a lidded container and freeze for a few hours or until firm.
Serve scoops of mango sorbet in chilled bowls.

title: Oreo Cheesecake
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F.
In a bowl; combine Oreo cookie crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a greased 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl; beat cream cheese; sugar; and vanilla until smooth.
Add eggs one at a time; beating well after each addition. Stir in sour cream.
Fold in crushed Oreo cookies.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust.
Bake for 50-55 minutes or until the center is set.
Let it cool in the pan; then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Slice and serve chilled.

title: Blueberry Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a bowl; whisk together flour; sugar; baking powder; and salt.
In another bowl; mix melted butter; eggs; milk; and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in blueberries.
Spoon the batter into lined muffin cups.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Let the muffins cool before serving.

title: Pumpkin Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a bowl; combine pumpkin puree; brown sugar; cinnamon; ginger; cloves; and salt.
In another bowl; whisk eggs and stir in evaporated milk.
Add the egg mixture to the pumpkin mixture and mix until well combined.
Pour the filling into the pie crust.
Bake for 15 minutes; then reduce the oven temperature to 350°F and bake for an additional 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted comes out clean.
Let it cool before slicing and serving.

title: Caramel Apple Crisp
ingredients: 6 cups Apples; peeled; cored; and sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl; combine sliced apples; granulated sugar; cinnamon; and nutmeg.
Pour the apple mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
In another bowl; combine oats; flour; brown sugar; and melted butter. Mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle the oat mixture over the apples.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the topping is golden brown and the apples are tender.
Drizzle caramel sauce over the crisp before serving.

title: Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries
ingredients: 1 pound Fresh strawberries; washed and dried
8 ounces Semisweet or dark chocolate; chopped
instructions: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a microwave-safe bowl; melt the chocolate and coconut oil in 30-second intervals; stirring between each interval.
Dip each strawberry into the melted chocolate; coating about two-thirds of the berry.
Place the dipped strawberries on the prepared baking sheet.
Allow the chocolate to set by placing the strawberries in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
Serve and enjoy your chocolate-dipped strawberries!

title: Cherry Almond Cake
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups Fresh or frozen cherries; pitted and halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl; whisk together flour; baking powder; baking soda; and salt.
In another bowl; cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time; then stir in almond extract.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture alternately with buttermilk; beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
Gently fold in cherries and sliced almonds.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool before slicing.
